thread.title: Out of favour Manchester City star Samir Nasri sells lavish Cheshire mansion for cool £5.7million
thread.title_full: Out of favour Manchester City star Samir Nasri sells lavish Cheshire mansion for cool £5.7million

author: mirror
title: Out of favour Manchester City star Samir Nasri sells lavish Cheshire mansion for cool £5.7million
text:
Sport Out of favour Manchester City star Samir Nasri sells lavish Cheshire mansion for cool £5.7million There are five bathrooms, a study, playroom, open plan kitchen as well as a jacuzzi, steam room and a sauna. Share Nasri has sold his house for a pretty penny (Photo: MEN Media/Action Images via Reuters) Share Get football   
Manchester City's out-on-loan midfielder Samir Nasri has sold his lavish Cheshire home for a cool £5.75million. 
Nasri, spending the season with Spanish side Sevilla, had put his eight bedroom mansion on the market back in October, reports the Manchester Evening News. 
The French ace had been renting out the property during his time with City, who paid £25million to take him from Arsenal in 2011. 
Set back on the 30 acre, private plot in the exclusive Alderly Edge area, the amazing home opens up into a marble entrance hall with a spiral staircase and floor to ceiling windows. 
And there are of course, the obvious trappings that come as standard in the millionaire’s pad - his and her dressing rooms, a huge wine cellar, the cinema room and state of the art gym. I mean, it looks rather nice! (Photo: MEN Media) Nasri's home has been sold (Photo: MEN Media) A very nice dinner table (Photo: MEN Media) Plenty of space for friends (Photo: MEN Media) 
There are also five bathrooms, a study, playroom, and open plan kitchen/diner as well as a jacuzzi, steam room and a sauna. 
But this is much more than just your run of the mill footballer’s house, this swanky Cheshire home has a surprise that puts it in a league of its own. 
The new owners won’t have to shell out on taxis to Manchester any more as they will be able to bring the party to them as it comes complete with its very own nightclub, 
Boasting a dance floor and fully-working bar, as well as a lounge area and seating around the 9m pool, for guests to relax. Fancy a dip? (Photo: MEN Media) A nightclub...in your house! (Photo: MEN Media) A rather elegant lounge (Photo: MEN Media) Read More CHEAT! Samir Nasri slams Leicester's Jamie Vardy 
Outside the new owners will be able to enjoy their lavish 32-acre gardens. 
And if they happen to own any horses then they are certainly in luck, with three stables and a track to take them for a ride. 
There is more than enough space to relax as well with a Summer house, a number of plush terraces and even a private waterfall. poll loading A nightclub in your house: Good idea? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
